FuncDef:
The service-class edsg keep-queue-level command allows a device to retain the service class of the original packets after the EDSG service is matched to a traffic behavior.
The undo service-class edsg keep-queue-level command restores the default configuration.
By default, the service class of the EDSG service overrides that of the original packets after the EDSG service is matched to a traffic behavior.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When EDSG service traffic includes packets of multiple service classes, to allow a device to implement queue scheduling based on the service class of the original packets, run the service-class edsg keep-queue-level command. After the EDSG service is matched to a traffic behavior, the service class of the EDSG service does not override that of the original packets. Instead, the service class of the original packets is retained.
Prerequisites
A traffic behavior has been configured, and the traffic behavior view is displayed.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
This command applies only to the UCL.This command is mutually exclusive to the following commands in the traffic behavior view:cardns-redirecthttp-redirectdenyredirect-cpu http-redirect-chastenredirect-cpu portalservice-classtariff-leveltraffic-statistic
